channel.title: CVE Feed for Canonical -- apport
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Canonical -- apport

item.title: CVE-2021-32557|2024-09-16T17:53:05.508Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: It was discovered that the process_report() function in data/whoopsie-upload-all allowed arbitrary file writes via symlinks.

item.title: CVE-2019-11485|2024-09-16T16:57:41.110Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: Sander Bos discovered Apport's lock file was in a world-writable directory which allowed all users to prevent crash handling.

item.title: CVE-2020-15702|2024-09-16T17:28:12.244Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: TOCTOU Race Condition vulnerability in apport allows a local attacker to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code. An attacker may exit the crashed process and exploit PID recycling to spawn a root process with the same PID as the crashed process, which can then be used to escalate privileges. Fixed in 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.24, 2.20.9 versions prior to 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.16 and 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.6. Was ZDI-CAN-11234.
